localString.value: Hello again, <FirstName>. I hope you are doing well.
<FirstName>, your assistance with a matter is required.
For some time, a band of kobolds has been camping in the Benzor Swamp. This in itself is only a minor irritation, but a few weeks ago...events took a darker turn.

Hordes of kobolds poured out of the swamp. They were followed by lizard folk and the lot of them threw themselves against the city's defenses. Fortunately, a brave band of adventurers was able to stem the tide. I sent this band into the swamp to investigate the mystery behind the attack.

It turns out that a trio of black dragons were behind the assault. The heroes confronted and slew the beasts, but not before the foul beasts bragged about an excavation that was almost complete. I fear that the darkness that I now sense close to Benzor is an ancient evil that these lizard creatures have awoken.

So you and any brave companions you can find are to journey into the swamp area...go north out of the city and find the path towards the swamps to the east, behind the old quarry. Find out the source of the evil and I shall reward you greatly.
So <FirstName>, what have you found concerning the swamp and lizard people?
Most wonderful! I have a reward for you...please tell me what you prefer.
Greetings little <race>. What business brings you here today?
Spirited, are we? Good. The coming battle will require creatures of action, like yourself.
I visit. I watch. I wait.
Indeed? Well, perhaps you should step back and look around.
Citizens scurry about, busy yet unaware of the danger that has fallen over the land.
A darkness...which is led, I believe, by one who should have been dead long ago. But I need to know more.

I hope so. Become stronger and more skilled. Also, search about in the abandoned places, the far away places. Look for servants of darkness and the clues that they may carry. Time may be short for all of us.
Why do you dally? Blackavar's plans wait for no one.
Have you discovered anything more concerning the danger to Nordock?
Indeed it is! This is a wonderful piece of good fortune.

These tokens are how Blackavar enslaves the higher-powered fiends to do his bidding. But the tokens themselves are attuned to an aritfact, possibly some sort of altar that Blackavar would use to control them.

I have now blessed your Token with a spell. You must find Blackavar, for the summoning aritfact is no doubt nearby. Destroying him may not be possible, as a lich may continue to return until his hidden phylactory is destroyed, However, you can use this now blessed Token to start a destructive magical burst that should destroy the summoning artifact. If we can eliminate this, Blackavar will be thwarted for quite a long time.

Some time ago, a journal was recovered from a fallen priest in the caverns on Misty Isle. This journal indicated that Blackavar may use the island as a base for an invasion. Recently, dark magic has been detected on the northern half of the island. That would be the most logical place to investigate.
All of Nordock looks to you. Do not fail.
You have exceeded my greatest expectations, <FirstName>. It is with great pleasure that I give you this key.

The key will grant you access to the village of Bren. It is a strange village, but the people there are enlightened. There is a slaad there called Rudash who will be able to give you something interesting.
What may I do?
What happened?
What was found?
I don't have time now, Lord Galdor.
This rune of power was discovered on a Lich that was in an old temple. It seems that the lizards and kobolds and dragons were following him.
I would like a magical ring.
I would like a magical longbow.
I would like a magical longsword.
I would like magical heavy armor
Bugger off, lizard!
What battle?
I could ask the same thing of you, good dragon.
Wait for what?
Nothing special, Lord Galdor.
What do you mean?
What danger?
Is there anyway for me to help?
Werdna told me that this Token of Possession was important and that I should bring it to you.
Why is that? Werdna didn't seem to feel that way at all.
I see. Where can I find him?
Very well. Blackavar shall be stopped.
Thank you Galdor.
